deleteDialog.title: Delete Notebook
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone and will delete all sources, notes, and chat sessions.

deleteDialog.title: Delete Notebook
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone and will delete all sources, notes, and chat sessions.

empty.title: No notes yet
empty.description: Create your first note to capture insights and observations.

deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete this note? This action cannot be undone.

empty.title: No sources yet
empty.description: Add your first source to start building your knowledge base.

deleteDialog.title: Delete Source
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete this source? This action cannot be undone.

removeDialog.title: Remove Source from Notebook
removeDialog.description: Are you sure you want to remove this source from the notebook? The source itself will not be deleted.

createDialog.title: Create New Notebook
createDialog.description: Start organizing your research with a dedicated space for related sources and notes.
createDialog.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe the purpose and scope of this notebook...

notebooks.title: Select Notebooks (optional)
notebooks.description: Choose which notebooks should contain this source. You can select multiple notebooks or leave this empty.

transformations.title: Transformations (optional)
transformations.description: Apply AI transformations to analyze and extract insights from your content.

settings.title: Processing Settings
settings.description: Configure how your source will be processed and stored.

enable.title: Enable embedding for search
enable.description: Allows this source to be found in vector searches and AI queries

always.title: Embedding enabled automatically
always.description: Your settings are configured to always embed content for vector search. You can change this in Settings.

never.title: Embedding disabled
never.description: Your settings are configured to skip embedding. Vector search won't be available for this source. You can change this in Settings.

sourceType.stepDescription: Choose how you want to add your content

link.label: Link
link.description: Add a web page or URL

https://example.com/article1
https://example.com/article2
url.hint: Paste multiple URLs (one per line) to batch import

errors.title: Invalid URLs detected:
errors.fix: Please fix or remove invalid URLs to continue

file.label: File(s) *
file.hint: Select multiple files to batch import. Supported: Documents (PDF, DOC, DOCX, PPT, XLS, EPUB, TXT, MD), Media (MP4, MP3, WAV, M4A), Images (JPG, PNG), Archives (ZIP)

content.label: Text Content *
content.placeholder: Paste or type your content here...

title.optionalDescription: If left empty, a title will be generated from the content
title.requiredDescription: A title is required for text content
title.placeholder: Give your source a descriptive title

batch.description: Titles will be automatically generated for each source. The same notebooks and transformations will be applied to all items.

page.subtitle: Browse all sources across your notebooks. Use arrow keys to navigate and Enter to open.

empty.title: No sources yet
empty.description: Sources from all notebooks will appear here

addDialog.description: Add content from links, uploads, or text to your notebooks.

validation.contentRequired: Please provide the required content for the selected source type

processing.error: Error creating source. Please try again.

errors.selectAtLeastOne: Please select at least one notebook

page.title: Podcasts
page.description: Keep track of generated episodes and manage reusable templates.

episodesTab.description: Monitor podcast generation jobs and review the final artefacts.

running.title: Currently Processing
running.description: Episodes that are actively generating assets.

pending.title: Queued / Pending
pending.description: Submitted episodes waiting to start processing.

completed.title: Completed Episodes
completed.description: Ready to review, download, or publish.

failed.description: Episodes that encountered issues during generation.

loadFailed.title: Failed to load episodes
loadFailed.description: We could not fetch the latest podcast episodes. Try again shortly.

episodesTab.emptyState: No podcast episodes yet. Generate your first one from the notebook or source chat interfaces.

deleteDialog.title: Delete episode?
deleteDialog.description: This will remove "{name}" and its audio file permanently.

episodeProfilesPanel.title: Episode profiles
episodeProfilesPanel.description: Define reusable generation settings for your shows.
episodeProfilesPanel.speakerProfileRequired: Create a speaker profile before adding an episode profile.
episodeProfilesPanel.emptyState: No episode profiles yet. Create one to kickstart podcast generation.

deleteDialog.title: Delete profile?
deleteDialog.description: This will remove "{name}". Existing episodes keep their data, but new ones will no longer use this configuration.

speakerProfilesPanel.title: Speaker profiles
speakerProfilesPanel.description: Configure voices and personalities for generated episodes.
speakerProfilesPanel.emptyState: No speaker profiles yet. Create one to make episode templates available.

usage.used: Used by {count} episode{count, plural, one{} other{s}}

deleteDialog.title: Delete speaker profile?
deleteDialog.inUseWarning: Remove this speaker from episode profiles before deleting it.

templatesTab.title: Templates workspace
templatesTab.description: Build reusable episode and speaker configurations for fast podcast production.

loadFailed.title: Failed to load templates data
loadFailed.description: Ensure the API is running and try again. Some sections may be incomplete.

overview.title: How templates power podcast generation
overview.introduction: Templates split the podcast workflow into two reusable building blocks. Mix and match them whenever you generate a new episode.

points.segments: Outline the number of segments and how the story flows
points.models: Pick the language models used for briefing, outlining, and script writing
points.briefings: Store default briefings so every episode starts with a consistent tone

speakerProfiles.title: Speaker profiles bring voices to life

points.tts: Choose the text-to-speech provider and model
points.details: Capture personality, backstory, and pronunciation notes per speaker
points.reuse: Reuse the same host or guest voices across different episode formats

workflow.title: Recommended workflow

steps.createSpeakers: Create speaker profiles for each voice you need
steps.buildEpisodes: Build episode profiles that reference those speakers by name
steps.generate: Generate podcasts by selecting the episode profile that fits the story

workflow.note: Episode profiles reference speaker profiles by name, so starting with speakers avoids missing voice assignments later.

generateDialog.title: Generate Podcast Episode
generateDialog.description: Select the content to include and configure the episode details before generating a new podcast episode.

contentSection.title: Content
contentSection.description: Pick notebooks, sources, and notes to include in this episode.
contentSection.noNotebooks: No notebooks found. Create a notebook and add content before generating a podcast.

settingsSection.instructionsPlaceholder: Any supplemental guidance to append to the episode briefing...
settingsSection.instructionsHint: These instructions will be appended to the episode profile's default briefing.
settingsSection.submitHint: The episode will appear in the Episodes list once generation starts. Refresh the list to monitor progress.

profileRequired.description: Select an episode profile before generating a podcast.

nameRequired.title: Episode name required
nameRequired.description: Provide a name for the episode.

addContext.title: Add context
addContext.description: Select at least one source or note to include in the episode.

episodeProfile.description: Define how episodes should be generated and which speaker configuration they use by default.

noSpeakerProfiles.title: No speaker profiles available
noSpeakerProfiles.description: Create a speaker profile before configuring an episode profile.

noLanguageModels.description: Add language models in the Models section to configure outline and transcript generation.

description.placeholder: Short summary of when to use this profile

defaultBriefing.label: Default briefing
defaultBriefing.placeholder: Outline the structure, tone, and goals for this episode format

speakerProfile.description: Configure text-to-speech settings and define up to four speakers.

noTtsModels.title: No text-to-speech models available

description.label: Description
description.placeholder: Notes about tone, brand, or usage

speakersSection.title: Speakers
speakersSection.description: Configure between one and four voices for this profile.
speakersSection.speaker: Speaker {index}

backstory.label: Backstory
backstory.placeholder: Short biography or context for the speaker

errors.atLeastOneSpeaker: At least one speaker is required
errors.maxFourSpeakers: You can configure up to 4 speakers

page.title: Model Management
page.description: Configure AI models for different purposes across Open Notebook

providerStatus.title: AI Providers
providerStatus.description: Configure providers through environment variables to enable their models.

defaultModels.title: Default Model Assignments
defaultModels.description: Configure which models to use for different purposes across Open Notebook
defaultModels.missingRequired: Missing required models: {models}. Open Notebook may not function properly without these.

transformationModel.label: Transformation Model
transformationModel.description: Used for summaries, insights, and transformations

toolsModel.label: Tools Model
toolsModel.description: Used for function calling - OpenAI or Anthropic recommended

largeContextModel.label: Large Context Model
largeContextModel.description: Used for processing large documents - Gemini recommended

embeddingModel.label: Embedding Model
embeddingModel.description: Used for semantic search and vector embeddings

embeddingChangeDialog.title: Embedding Model Change
embeddingChangeDialog.description: You are about to change your embedding model

warning.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Rebuild Required
warning.message: Changing your embedding model requires rebuilding all existing embeddings to maintain consistency. Without rebuilding, your searches may return incorrect or incomplete results.

points.update: Your default embedding model will be updated
points.unchanged: Existing embeddings will remain unchanged until rebuild
points.newContent: New content will use the new embedding model
points.rebuildSoon: You should rebuild embeddings as soon as possible

embeddingChangeDialog.proceedQuestion: Would you like to proceed to the Advanced page to start the rebuild now?

deleteDialog.title: Delete Model
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.

addModel.dialogDescription: Configure a new {type} model from available providers.

fields.azureHint: For Azure, use the deployment name as the model name

page.title: Transformations
page.description: Transformations are prompts that will be used by the LLM to process a source and extract insights, summaries, etc.

list.title: Your Transformations
list.emptyDescription: Create your first transformation to process and extract insights from your content.

deleteDialog.title: Delete Transformation
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.

fields.applyDefault: Suggest by default on new sources

prompt.label: Prompt
prompt.placeholder: Write the prompt that will power this transformation...
prompt.hint: Prompts should be written with the source content in mind. You can ask the model to summarise, extract insights, or produce structured outputs such as tables.

defaultPrompt.title: Default Transformation Prompt
defaultPrompt.description: This will be added to all your transformation prompts

playground.title: Playground
playground.description: Test your transformations on sample text before applying them to your sources

contentProcessing.title: Content Processing
contentProcessing.description: Configure how documents and URLs are processed

help.doclingDesc: is a little slower but more accurate, specially if the documents contain tables and images.
help.simpleDesc: will extract any content from the document without formatting it. It's ok for simple documents, but will lose quality in complex ones.
help.autoDesc: will try to process through docling and default to simple.

help.firecrawlDesc: is a paid service (with a free tier), and very powerful.
help.jinaDesc: is a good option as well and also has a free tier.
help.simpleDesc: will use basic HTTP extraction and will miss content on javascript-based websites.
help.autoDesc: will try to use firecrawl (if API Key is present). Then, it will use Jina until reaches the limit (or will keep using Jina if you setup the API Key). It will fallback to simple, when none of the previous options is possible.

help.intro: Embedding the content will make it easier to find by you and by your AI agents. If you are running a local embedding model (Ollama, for example), you shouldn't worry about cost and just embed everything. For online providers, you might want to be careful only if you process a lot of content (like 100s of documents at a day).
help.always: Choose always if you are running a local embedding model or if your content volume is not that big
help.ask: Choose ask if you want to decide every time
help.never: Choose never if you don't care about vector search or do not have an embedding provider.
help.reference: As a reference, OpenAI's text-embedding-3-small costs about 0.02 for 1 million tokens -- which is about 30 times the Wikipedia page for Earth. With Gemini API, Text Embedding 004 is free with a rate limit of 1500 requests per minute.

fileManagement.title: File Management
fileManagement.description: Configure file handling and storage options
fileManagement.label: Auto Delete Files

help.intro: Once your files are uploaded and processed, they are not required anymore. Most users should allow Open Notebook to delete uploaded files from the upload folder automatically. Choose no, ONLY if you are using Notebook as the primary storage location for those files (which you shouldn't be at all). This option will soon be deprecated in favor of always downloading the files.
help.yes: Choose yes (recommended) to automatically delete uploaded files after processing
help.no: Choose no only if you need to keep the original files in the upload folder

page.title: Advanced
page.description: Advanced tools and utilities for power users

systemInfo.title: System Information
systemInfo.checkFailed: Unable to check for updates. GitHub may be unreachable.

rebuildEmbeddings.title: üîÑ Rebuild Embeddings
rebuildEmbeddings.description: Rebuild vector embeddings for your content. Use this when switching embedding models or fixing corrupted embeddings.

hint.existing: Re-embed only items that already have embeddings (faster, for model switching)
hint.all: Re-embed existing items + create embeddings for items without any (slower, comprehensive)

validation.required: Please select at least one item type to rebuild

status.backgroundHint: You can leave this page as this will run in the background

switching.title: Switching embedding models:
switching.description: If you change from one embedding model to another, you need to rebuild all embeddings to ensure consistency.

upgrading.title: Upgrading model versions:
upgrading.description: When updating to a newer version of your embedding model, rebuild to take advantage of improvements.

fixing.title: Fixing corrupted embeddings:
fixing.description: If you suspect some embeddings are corrupted or missing, rebuilding can restore them.

importing.title: After bulk imports:
importing.description: If you imported content without embeddings, use "All" mode to embed everything.

time.title: How long does rebuilding take?

local.title: Local models
local.description: (Ollama): Very fast, limited only by hardware

cloud.title: Cloud APIs
cloud.description: (OpenAI, Google): Moderate speed, may hit rate limits with large datasets

sources.title: Sources:
sources.description: Slower than notes/insights (creates multiple chunks per source)

time.example: Example: Rebuilding 200 items might take 2-5 minutes with cloud APIs, or under 1 minute with local models.

safe.title: Is it safe to rebuild while using the app?
safe.intro: Yes, rebuilding is safe! The rebuild process:

idempotent.title: Is idempotent:
idempotent.description: Running multiple times produces the same result

anytime.title: Can be run anytime:
anytime.description: No need to stop other operations

errors.title: Handles errors gracefully:
errors.description: Failed items are logged and skipped

warning.title: However
warning.description: Very large rebuilds (1000s of items) may temporarily slow down searches while processing.
